title: Windows needs a command-line Package Manager
body: I think that Microsoft could achieve the following 3 things if you seriously thought about a package management strategy for Windows and Windows programs.

comments.body: Chocolatey already does this - and rather well too.
This sort of thing is way out of scope for this project. These devs have literally no control over that sort of thing.
You mean like OneGet? The command line package manager that allows you to add other package repositories, including Chocolaty's, and came in Windows 10?

I love the fact that we can install via APT in Ubuntu/BASH. I really wish Microsoft would develop a simple repository system similar to Chocolaty for installing applications from the command line. And being able to do so from BASH would be even better.
